column4: I just installed Ubuntu 9.04 on an empty hard drive, but it refuses to boot, instead giving me a grub prompt. I don't know how to go on or boot from there and pressing escape just refreshes the screen. I tried saying root (hd0,0) and setup (hd0), but it did not help. What can I do?
it seems your boot flasg is wrong
how would I correct that? I'm at the grub prompt now
boot again from ubuntu cd/dvd and in the partition setup change the boot flag where you have installed ubuntu
now the cd fails to boot :/ it's stuck at "Setting Advanced Power Management level to 0xfe (254) [ OK ]"
that is strange try in the boot options with no acpi
In the CD menu, I set (under F6 - Other Options) acpi=off, but now it's stuck with the same reason
this is going strange to awkward, now try to set default in bios
what do you mean by "setting default in bios"?
go to bios and in the main menu there should be some-kind of set default button
after resetting my BIOS settings the CD boots fine. I'll see now about the boot flag
good luck
the boot flag is on in /dev/sda1
and /dev/sda1 is the partition I would like to boot from
and you have installed ubuntu in that partition?
yes
what was the error again?
trying to boot the computer just throws me to the grub prompt
now that you a set the bios on default, have you tries booting ubuntu again?
yes, doesn't work
no error? it just throws you. he he, not literally
yep
i know it sounds stupid but, try installing it again
maybe its just a faulty grub install
